name: Antimonium Tartaricum(Ant Tart)
details:
Therapeutic application has been confined largely to the treatment of respiratory diseases, rattling of mucus with little expectoration has been a guiding symptom.
There is much drowsiness, debiliity and sweat characteristic of the drug, which group should always be more or less present, when the drug is prescribed.
Gastric affections of drunkards and gouty subjects. Cholera morbus. Sensation of coldness in blood-vessels. Bilharziasis.
Anitmonium tart is homoepathic to dysuria, stranguary, hematuria, albuminuria, catarrh of bladder and urethra, burning in rectum, bloody mucus stools, etc.
Antimon tart acts indirectly on the parasites by stimulating the oxidizing action of the protective substance. By-effects following ijection for Bilharziasis. 
Chills and contractures and muscular pains. Warts on glans penis.
dosage: Second to sixth trituration. The lower potencies sometimes aggravate. (Soham:2)

Head: Headache as freom a band compressing.
Face pale and sunken.
Vertigo alternates with drowsiness.
Child will not be touched without whining.
Bnad like feeling over forehead.
Tongue: Coated, pasty, think white, with red edges.
Red and dry, especially in the center.
Face: Cold, blue, pale; corevered with cold sweat.
Incessant quivering of chin and lower jaw.
Stomach: Thirst for cold water, little and often, and desire for apples, fruits, and acids generally.
Nausea, retching, and vomiting, especially after food, with deathly faintness and prostration.
Vomiting in any position, except lying on right side.
Nausea produces fear; with pressure in praecordial region, followed by headache with yawning and lachrymation and vomiting.
Abdomen: Pressure in abdomen, especially on stooping forward.
Urine: Burning in urethra during and after urinating.
Last drops bloody with pain in bladder.
Respiratory: Great rattling of mucus, but very little is expectorated.
Cough excited by eating, with pain in chest and larynx.
Burning sensation in chest, which ascends to throat.
Edema and impending paralysis of lungs.
Much palpitation, with uncomfortable hot feeling.
Cough and dyspnea better lying on right side.
Rapid, short, difficult breathing; seems as if he would suffocate; must sit up.
Back: Sensation of heavy weight at the coccyx, dragging downward all the time.
Slighest effort to move may cause retching and cold, clammy sweat.
Skin: Pustular eruption, leaving a bluish-red mark.
Fever: Cold, clammy sweat, with great faintness.
Sleep: Irresistible inclination to sleep with nearly all complaints.
On falling asleep, electric like shocks.
Modalities: Worse: from lying down at night.
Worse: from all sour things and milk.
